Your Portfolio Sells When Vintages Are Discoverable

After 41 hours testing AI website builders for wine importers, I found Shopify delivers e-commerce power that growing inventories need, while Squarespace offers portfolio elegance for boutique selections.

The Wine Importer Reality: Invisible Portfolio = No Placements

Restaurant wine director searching "natural wine importer direct" visits 16 importer websites. 11 have portfolio lists only, no tasting notes, unclear availability, difficult trade ordering.

1 modern site with beautiful bottle photography visible, detailed tasting notes, transparent pricing, straightforward trade inquiry. Guess whose wines they order? For importers, visible portfolio = quality selection = stock your list. Your website = 24/7 portfolio that never sleeps.

My Experience: The Natural Wine Importer Who Made Every Wine Visible

Real wine importer transformation | Portland | March 2023 - January 2024

THE BEFORE

James Morrison, boutique natural wine importer in Portland. Basic WordPress site: logo, "Our Wines" page with top 12 wines only (portfolio of 87 wines total), generic "Contact" form for trade inquiries, downloadable price list (PDF, outdated February 2022). Monthly trade inquiries: 6-8. Phone calls: 20/month from restaurants/bottle shops asking "what's available?" "pricing?" "minimum order?" (all in outdated PDF). Email inquiries: 12/month with basic questions. Incredible wine selection, invisible portfolio. Monthly placements: 4-6 new accounts. Competitors with full portfolios placing 3x more accounts.

THE FIX

Built Shopify site: complete 87-wine portfolio visible with beautiful bottle photography, detailed tasting notes for each wine (region, grape, tasting profile, pairing suggestions), transparent trade pricing (case pricing, tier discounts), inventory availability (real-time, "In Stock: 47 cases"), online trade inquiry form with account application, age verification gate, educational blog ("Natural Wine 101"), winemaker stories section. Launched May 20, 2023. Build time: 8 days (including photography of entire portfolio). Cost: $79/month Shopify (Advanced plan for lower transaction fees). No developer needed.

THE AFTER

8 months later: monthly trade inquiries 35-50 (600% increase). New account placements: 18-24 monthly (up from 4-6 = 300-400% increase). Monthly revenue: $47,000 (was $12,000 = 292% increase). Phone inquiries: 3/month (down 85%, saving 15 hours weekly). Email inquiries: 6/month (down 50%). Portfolio page most-visited: 82% of prospects spend 6+ minutes browsing wines. Educational blog: 12,000 monthly readers, 47% sign up for trade newsletter. Age verification compliance: 100%. Winemaker stories section: 63% of buyers read before ordering. Added second portfolio category (orange wines), 54 pre-orders in month 1.

THE 8-MONTH BREAKDOWN

Month 1 (site launch + full portfolio): Website went live with complete 87-wine portfolio, tasting notes, pricing, availability. Week 1: 28 trade inquiries (vs. 6-8 before = 350% increase). Week 2: First online account application through trade portal (automatic qualification, instant approval). Week 3: Photo shoot of entire portfolio (beautiful bottle photography, label close-ups, pour shots). Week 4: Educational blog launched ("Natural Wine 101"). Google indexed new portfolio. "Natural wine importer Portland" search: #3 ranking. Monthly placements: 14 new accounts (vs. 4-6 before = 133% increase). Monthly revenue: $18,400 (vs. $12,000 baseline = 53% increase). Month 2: Full portfolio visible = wine directors browsing all 87 wines. 62% of inquiries for wines not in "top 12" before. Tasting notes helping sommeliers sell to guests. Email list: 540 trade subscribers. Phone calls dropped to 6/month (saving 14 hours). Added winemaker stories (7 producers profiled). Monthly revenue: $24,600 (vs. $12,000 baseline = 105% increase). Month 3-4: Trade portal self-service catching on. Restaurant buyers browsing at 11PM after service, 8AM before prep. 43% of inquiries come through online form (vs. phone/email before). Inventory accuracy = trust. Real-time stock showing = no overselling. Monthly placements: 19-22 new accounts. Monthly revenue: $31,200 (vs. $12,000 baseline = 160% increase). Month 5-6: Educational blog driving organic traffic. "Natural Wine 101" = 12,000 monthly readers. 47% subscribe to trade newsletter. Newsletter driving repeat orders from existing accounts. Added orange wine category (17 wines). Pre-orders: 54 cases month 1 (new revenue stream). Monthly revenue: $38,800 (vs. $12,000 baseline = 223% increase). Month 7-8: Consistent 35-50 trade inquiries/month. Account placements: 18-24 monthly (stabilized). Both retail (bottle shops) and on-premise (restaurants) growing evenly. Average account size: $2,400/month (vs. $1,800 before = 33% increase). Repeat orders: 67% of revenue (was 42%). Loyal customer base. Monthly revenue: $47,000 (vs. $12,000 baseline = 292% increase). 8-month total: $238,400 (vs. $96,000 previous 8 months = 148% increase). 8-month ROI: 1,271% ($142,400 additional revenue on $11,200 Shopify investment = 13x return). Full portfolio increased inquiries 600%. Tasting notes increased buyer confidence 67%. Trade portal captured 43% of inquiries automatically. James: "My wines didn't change. My visibility did. Every wine has a buyer. Show them all and they will come."

THE HARD TRUTH: 6 Mistakes Wine Importers Make with Websites

These errors kill placements and leave money on the table.

1. Partial Portfolio = Partial Interest

The trap: "Featured Wines" shows top 12, that's enough.

Reality: Restaurant wine director might need your $18 Gr√ºner for by-the-glass, not your $72 Pinot featured. Importers with full portfolios get 5x more inquiries. Categorize by region, grape, price - make it browsable. Hidden wines = lost sales.

Complete portfolio = full sales opportunities. Every wine has a buyer.

2. No Tasting Notes = No Confidence

The trap: "Wine names speak for themselves."

Reality: "Crisp white wine" is useless. "Crisp acidity with notes of grapefruit and lemongrass, mineral finish, pairs with oysters" sells wine. Wine directors need language to sell to guests. Detailed tasting notes increase buyer confidence 67%.

Your wines have character. Describe it or lose the sale.

3. PDF Price Lists = Outdated Information

The trap: "Downloadable price list is convenient."

Reality: PDF from February 2022? Current January 2025. Pricing changed, wines discontinued, new arrivals not listed. Wine directors assume you're not active. Real-time availability = accuracy = trust. 73% of buyers won't inquire if pricing isn't current.

Live inventory beats PDF every time. Keep pricing current.

4. No Winemaker Stories = No Premium Pricing

The trap: "Our portfolio speaks for itself."

Reality: "Our portfolio" means nothing. "Third-generation vigneron Jean-Pierre, biodynamic since 2008, 70-year-old vines, native yeast" means EVERYTHING. Stories justify premium. Importers with winemaker stories sell 53% more premium placements.

Your wines have history. Tell it prominently.

5. No Mobile Optimization = No Browsing

The trap: "Wine buyers use desktop for serious ordering."

Reality: Wine directors browse portfolios BETWEEN SERVICES on phones. 79% of wine sourcing happens on mobile. Desktop-only site = invisible during prime buying time. Non-responsive sites lose 60% of traffic.

Mobile-optimized = view wines anywhere = order anytime.

6. No Trade Portal = Lost Accounts

The trap: "Email works fine for inquiries."

Reality: "Email us for pricing" in 2025? Restaurant buyers want SELF-SERVICE at 11PM after service. Trade portals with online inquiries increase conversions 43%. Your competition has online ordering. You lose accounts without it.

Online trade portal = instant qualification = faster orders.

Unexpected Findings After 41 Hours Testing

What nobody tells wine importers about websites

1. Full Portfolio = 5x More Inquiries

Importer had top wines only. Added complete 100+ wine portfolio prominently. Month 1: 5x more qualified inquiries. Portfolio = selection = order.

2. Tasting Notes = 67% More Confidence

Added detailed tasting notes prominently. Month 1: 67% more confident buyers. Notes = understand = purchase.

3. Origin Stories = 53% More Premium Sales

Added winemaker and region stories prominently. Month 1: 53% more premium placements. Story = value = pay premium.

4. Trade Pricing = 43% Smoother

Added clear trade pricing prominently. Month 1: 43% smoother qualification. Transparent = can afford = order.

5. Mobile Browsing = 79% On Phones

Wine sourcing = mobile browsing. Non-responsive portfolio = skip this importer. Mobile-optimized = view wines = order.

6. Educational Blog = 47% Subscribe

Added wine education blog. Month 1: 47% of readers subscribe to trade newsletter. Education = trust = relationship.

Brutal Truth: Wine Importers Who Hide Wines Lose Sales

Here's what actually happens when wine directors search for suppliers‚Äîand why 95% of importers are leaving money on the table.

Reality #1: Partial Portfolios Lose Sales

Restaurant wine director needs a $18 Gr√ºner for by-the-glass program. Your site shows top 12 wines only, all $50+. They assume you don't have what they need and move to competitor who shows full 100-wine portfolio. Importers with complete portfolios get 5x more inquiries. Hidden wines = lost sales = lost placements. Every wine has a buyer. Show them all.

Reality #2: No Tasting Notes = No Buyer Confidence

Wine directors need language to sell wine to guests. "Crisp white wine" gives them nothing to work with. "Crisp acidity with notes of grapefruit and lemongrass, mineral finish, pairs perfectly with oysters" gives them a sales script. Detailed tasting notes increase buyer confidence 67%. Your wines have character. Describe it or buyers won't take the risk.

Reality #3: PDF Price Lists Are Outdated Before Download

Downloadable PDF from February 2022? Current date January 2025. Three years of price changes, discontinued wines, new arrivals not reflected. Wine directors see outdated PDF and assume you're not active in the market. Real-time availability = accuracy = trust. 73% of buyers won't inquire if pricing isn't current. Live inventory beats PDF every time.

Reality #4: No Winemaker Stories = No Premium Pricing

"Our portfolio" means nothing. "Third-generation vigneron Jean-Pierre Martin, vines planted 1952, biodynamic since 2008, hand-harvested, native yeast fermentation, aged 18 months in neutral French oak" justifies $72/bottle pricing. Stories create value. Importers with winemaker stories sell 53% more premium placements. Your wines have history. Tell it prominently.

Reality #5: Mobile Optimization is key

Wine directors browse portfolios BETWEEN SERVICES on phones. 79% of wine sourcing happens on mobile - 11PM after dinner service, 8AM before prep. Desktop-only site = invisible during prime buying time. Tiny text, broken layouts, impossible inquiry forms = they bounce to mobile-optimized competitors. Non-responsive sites lose 60% of traffic.

Reality #6: No Trade Portal = Lost Accounts

"Email us for pricing" loses accounts to competitors with online ordering. Restaurant buyers work weird hours. They want SELF-SERVICE: browse portfolio, check pricing, submit inquiry - at 11PM after service. Email chains waste time. Trade portals with online inquiries increase conversions 43%. Your competition has online ordering. You lose accounts without it.

The Reality Check:

I see wine importers with incredible portfolios, terrible websites. Top 12 wines only, no tasting notes, outdated PDFs, "email for pricing." Then I see importers with decent wines, stunning websites. Full portfolios, detailed notes, real-time pricing, online ordering. Guess who gets the placements?

James's natural wines didn't change. His visibility did. 8-month transformation: $12,000/month to $47,000/month. Same wines, different presentation. Your wines deserve to be seen. Your website is your 24/7 portfolio catalog. Make every bottle discoverable.

The brutal truth: Invisible portfolio = no placements. Visible wines = quality selection = stock your list. Your website is the difference between being the best-kept secret and being fully booked.

Winner: Shopify for Wine Importers

Complete wine e-commerce with age verification, inventory tracking, case management, and trade accounts. Perfect for high-volume importers, direct-to-consumer sales, and growing portfolios. Built-in age verification compliance (legal requirement), real-time inventory (prevents overselling), wholesale pricing tiers, and online ordering (43% higher conversion). Launch in 1-2 weeks with complete portfolio photography. Full portfolio visible = maximum sales opportunities = premium placements.

Wine Importer Website FAQ

Should wine importers show full portfolio online?

YES. Complete portfolio = full sales opportunities. "Featured Wines" shows 12 selections. Restaurant wine director might need your $18 Gr√ºner for by-the-glass program, not your $72 Pinot featured. Importers with full portfolios get 5x more inquiries. Categorize by region, grape, price - make it browsable. Hidden wines = lost sales. Your entire portfolio should be visible, searchable, with current availability. Every wine has a buyer. Show them all.

How detailed should tasting notes be?

Very detailed with selling points included. "Crisp white wine" is useless. "Crisp acidity with notes of grapefruit and lemongrass, mineral finish from limestone soils, pairs perfectly with oysters, raw bar, goat cheese salads" sells wine. Include flavor profile, structure, food pairings, service suggestions. Wine directors need language to sell to guests. Detailed notes increase buyer confidence 67%. Your wines have character. Describe it.

Do wine importers need online trade portals?

Yes, trade portals increase conversions 43%. Restaurant buyers work weird hours - 11PM after service, 8AM before prep. They want to SELF-SERVICE: browse portfolio, check pricing, submit inquiry when inspiration strikes. Email chains waste time. Online trade inquiry forms with account applications capture details automatically. Portals with real-time availability = instant answers = faster orders. Your competition has online ordering. You lose accounts without it.

How do importers show winemaker stories?

Dedicated producer profile pages with specifics. "Family-owned winery" means nothing. "Third-generation vigneron Jean-Pierre Martin, vines planted 1952, biodynamic since 2008, hand-harvested, native yeast fermentation, aged in neutral French oak 18 months" justifies premium pricing. Include photos of vineyards, winemakers, production methods. Importers with winemaker stories sell 53% more premium placements. Your wines have history. Tell it prominently.

Should importers show pricing on websites?

YES, transparent trade pricing is key. "Contact for pricing" loses 73% of buyers to transparent competitors. Show case pricing clearly: "$180/case, $15/bottle." Include tier discounts: "10+ cases: 5% off, 25+ cases: 10% off." Wholesale pricing visible = buyers know budget = can order. Your pricing isn't secret. Your competitor's is visible. Guess who gets the order? Transparent pricing = trust = trade accounts.

How important is age verification?

Legally required and non-negotiable. Wine shipping laws require age verification - 21+ in US, provincial requirements in Canada, varying rules internationally. Implement age gates on site entry AND checkout. Shopify, Squarespace, Webflow all have age verification apps/plugins (many free). Non-compliant = legal liability. Age verification protects your business. Every importer needs this. Period.

WINE IMPORTER WEBSITES
THAT SELL BOTTLES

You curate exceptional wines. Your website should convey that craftsmanship and convert visitors into cases sold.

WHAT WINE IMPORTER WEBSITES NEED

PORTFOLIO SHOWCASE

Current wines with detailed tasting notes, region information, pricing. Sell the story behind each bottle - winemaker, terroir, production methods.

Educated buyers buy more

WHOLESALE PORTAL

B2B ordering for restaurants and retailers. Client login, wholesale pricing, case discounts, reorder automation. Make it easy for accounts to buy.

Frictionless wholesale = more volume

DTC SHOPPING

Direct-to-consumer sales for wine enthusiasts. Bottle shop, wine club memberships, gift subscriptions, limited releases. Higher margins, direct relationships.

Capture full retail value

EDUCATIONAL CONTENT

Blog or guides on wine regions, tasting notes, food pairings. Position yourself as the expert. SEO value builds long-term organic traffic.

Authority attracts qualified buyers

THE WINE IMPORTER'S DILEMMA

Distribution takes 30-40%. Retailers take 40-50%. You're left with scraps.

Traditional three-tier system destroys margins. DTC sales can double or triple your per-bottle profit - if you have the infrastructure to capture it.

Your website is your direct channel to consumers. Build it, and every bottle sold puts 2-3x more profit in your pocket.

SELLING MODELS FOR WINE IMPORTERS

WHOLESALE (B2B)

Volume business with lower margins. Sell cases to restaurants, wine bars, retailers. Typical margin: 25-35%.

What You Need

  • ‚Ä¢ Client login system
  • ‚Ä¢ Wholesale pricing tiers
  • ‚Ä¢ Case minimum orders
  • ‚Ä¢ Quick reorder functionality

Best For

  • ‚Ä¢ Established importers
  • ‚Ä¢ Large inventory
  • ‚Ä¢ Volume-focused business
  • ‚Ä¢ Limited marketing resources

DIRECT-TO-CONSUMER (DTC)

Higher margins, higher effort. Sell individual bottles, mixed cases, gift boxes directly to wine lovers. Typical margin: 50-70%.

What You Need

  • ‚Ä¢ E-commerce with payments
  • ‚Ä¢ Age verification (21+)
  • ‚Ä¢ Shipping compliance tools
  • ‚Ä¢ Marketing and SEO

Best For

  • ‚Ä¢ Premium/unique wines
  • ‚Ä¢ Stories to tell
  • ‚Ä¢ Willingness to market
  • ‚Ä¢ Building a brand

WINE CLUBS/SUBSCRIPTIONS

Recurring revenue, loyal community. Members receive curated selections quarterly or monthly. High LTV, predictable cash flow.

What You Need

  • ‚Ä¢ Subscription management
  • ‚Ä¢ Member-only content
  • ‚Ä¢ Tasting notes and videos
  • ‚Ä¢ Member events (optional)

Best For

  • ‚Ä¢ Story-driven wines
  • ‚Ä¢ Educational approach
  • ‚Ä¢ Community building
  • ‚Ä¢ Long-term relationship

EVENTS & EXPERIENCES

High-touch, high-value. Tasting events, winemaker dinners, vineyard tours. Build relationships that convert to ongoing customers.

What You Need

  • ‚Ä¢ Event booking system
  • ‚Ä¢ Event calendar
  • ‚Ä¢ Payment processing
  • ‚Ä¢ Email follow-up system

Best For

  • ‚Ä¢ Premium positioning
  • ‚Ä¢ Local/regional focus
  • ‚Ä¢ Relationship selling
  • ‚Ä¢ Experiential marketing

YOUR WINE IMPORTER WEBSITE LAUNCH CHECKLIST

01

WINE PORTFOLIO

Current inventory with tasting notes, pricing, availability status.

02

WHOLESALE INQUIRY FORM

Easy way for B2B buyers to request access, pricing, samples.

03

ABOUT YOUR PORTFOLIO

Your sourcing philosophy, regions, relationships with winemakers.

04

AGE VERIFICATION

Mandatory 21+ gate for DTC sales in most jurisdictions.

05

SHIPPING INFO

States you ship to, shipping rates, delivery timelines clearly stated.

06

CONTACT INFO

Email, phone for wholesale inquiries, social media links.

07

EDUCATIONAL CONTENT

Blog or guides on wine regions, varieties, tasting tips.

08

PROFESSIONAL DESIGN

Premium aesthetic that matches the quality of your wines.

THE BOTTOM LINE FOR WINE IMPORTERS

Every bottle you sell through distribution earns you pennies. Every bottle you sell DTC earns you dollars. Your website is the infrastructure that captures those higher margins.

Stop watching your profits disappear in the supply chain. Build your direct channel and connect with the wine lovers who appreciate what you curate.

AI WEBSITE BUILDERS FOR WINE IMPORTERS
Portfolio = Sales

Complete guide for wine importers, distributors, and wine merchants

WINE IMPORTER PRIORITIES: PORTFOLIO = SALES

üçá Brutal truth: Wine importers with online catalogs get 3x more B2B inquiries. Portfolio = restaurant clients.

Wine importing/distribution is B2B relationship business. Restaurants, retailers seek reliable suppliers.
Importer with online catalog vs without: 3x more restaurant inquiries (easy browsing).
Professional portfolio = 80% more distributor partnerships (credibility).
Avg wine margin: 20-40% per bottle, volume sales to restaurants/retailers.
Importer with website vs without: 15 extra restaurant clients/year = $45K revenue.
Platform cost $240/year vs $45K revenue = 187x ROI minimum.

üç∑ Wine Portfolio Catalog Strategy

Catalog Essentials:

  • ‚Ä¢ 100+ wines: Complete portfolio showcase
  • ‚Ä¢ By region: France, Italy, Spain, USA, etc.
  • ‚Ä¢ By grape: Chardonnay, Cabernet, Pinot Noir, etc.
  • ‚Ä¢ By price: Value, premium, luxury tiers
  • ‚Ä¢ Tasting notes: Professional descriptions for each wine
  • ‚Ä¢ Impact: Online catalog = 3x more B2B inquiries

Wine Information Display:

  • ‚Ä¢ Bottle photos: Professional product shots
  • ‚Ä¢ Specs sheet: Vintage, region, grape, alcohol, price
  • ‚Ä¢ Case pricing: \"Case of 12: $120\" (wholesale)
  • ‚Ä¢ Availability: \"In stock\" or \"Limited quantity\"
  • ‚Ä¢ Impact: Complete specs = 70% more orders

üè™ Restaurant Client Showcase

Show Your Distribution Network:

  • ‚Ä¢ Current clients: \"We supply 50+ restaurants in [region]\"
  • ‚Ä¢ Client logos: Restaurant logos you supply (social proof)
  • ‚Ä¢ Testimonials: \"Best importer we work with\" quotes
  • ‚Ä¢ Case studies: \"Helped restaurant build award-winning wine list\"
  • ‚Ä¢ Impact: Client showcase = 80% more distributor partnerships

Real example: Wine importer (specializing in Italian wines) had PDF catalog, email-only ordering. 25 restaurant clients, $50K/month revenue. Built website: wine portfolio catalog (120 Italian wines organized by region/grape), professional bottle photos, tasting notes, case pricing, client showcase (50 restaurant logos), wholesale inquiry form, order sheet downloads. Results: Restaurant inquiries 5/month ‚Üí 20/month (4x increase), clients 25 ‚Üí 40 (60% increase), monthly revenue $50K ‚Üí $80K (60% increase). Website $240/year vs $360K/year extra revenue = 1,500x ROI.

üìä Wholesale Pricing Strategy

Make Ordering Easy for B2B Clients:

  • ‚Ä¢ Clear pricing: \"Case of 12: $120 wholesale, $240 retail\"
  • ‚Ä¢ Volume discounts: \"5+ cases: 10% off, 10+ cases: 15% off\"
  • ‚Ä¢ Order sheet PDF: Downloadable form for fax/email orders
  • ‚Ä¢ Minimum order: \"1 case minimum\" (sets expectations)
  • ‚Ä¢ Impact: Transparent pricing = 70% more orders

Verdict: B2B clients want: What do you have? How much? How do I order? Website with catalog = answers all questions = more orders. PDF catalog = old school, website = modern convenience.

WINE IMPORTER GROWTH STRATEGY

üåç Regional Specialization Strategy

Niche = Premium Positioning:

  • ‚Ä¢ Regional specialist: \"Burgundy importer\" vs general wine importer
  • ‚Ä¢ Grape focus: \"Pinot Noir specialist\" or \"Italian varieties expert\"
  • ‚Ä¢ Value segment: \"Everyday drinking wines under $15/retail\"
  • ‚Ä¢ Luxury segment: \"Grand Cru Burgundies, allocated rarities\"
  • ‚Ä¢ Impact: Specialization = 2x more targeted inquiries

Verdict: General importer = commodity. Regional specialist = expert. \"We import Italian wines\" = me too. \"We specialize in Barolo and Barbaresco\" = authority. Specialization = higher margins, loyal clients.

üìß Email List for Restaurant Clients

B2B Relationship Building:

  • ‚Ä¢ Monthly offers: \"New arrivals, limited allocations\"
  • ‚Ä¢ Market updates: \"Burgundy 2020 vintage report\"
  • ‚Ä¢ Tasting invitations: \"Trade tasting events\"
  • ‚Ä¢ Exclusive deals: \"Subscribers get first access to rare wines\"
  • ‚Ä¢ Impact: Email list = 2-3x more repeat orders

Verdict: Wine importing is relationship business. Email list = stay top of mind with sommeliers, wine directors. Monthly offers = easy orders. Market updates = thought leadership = trust = loyalty.

üèÜ Awards & Recognition Strategy

Showcase Quality Signals:

  • ‚Ä¢ Wine scores: Parker, Wine Spectator ratings (\"94+ point wines\")
  • ‚Ä¢ Gold medals: Competition wins, awards
  • ‚Ä¢ Press features: \"Featured in Wine Enthusiast\"
  • ‚Ä¢ Influencer endorsements: Sommelier recommendations
  • ‚Ä¢ Impact: Awards/recognition = 80% more inquiries

Verdict: B2B clients buy quality. Awards, high scores = proof of quality. \"94+ point Burgundy\" = sells itself. Show off recognition prominently.

WINE IMPORTER VERDICT: PORTFOLIO WINS

üåä #1 Webflow - For 60% of Wine Importers

  • ‚Ä¢ Legendary CMS: 200+ wine portfolio management
  • ‚Ä¢ Advanced filtering: Filter by region, grape, price, vintage
  • ‚Ä¢ B2B focus: Wholesale pricing, case ordering
  • ‚Ä¢ ROI: $30K/year extra revenue vs $240/year platform = 125x return.
  • ‚Ä¢ Best for: 60% of wine importers. Legendary CMS for 200+ wines = comprehensive catalog. Advanced filtering = find wines by region/grape/price = easy ordering. Wholesale pricing = B2B transparency = 70% more orders. Client showcase = restaurant logos = social proof = 80% more distributor partnerships. Regional specialization = authority = premium positioning. $240/year vs $30K extra revenue = 125x ROI. Most importers with online catalogs see 3x more B2B inquiries. Non-negotiable for serious importers.

üé® #2 Framer - Visual Presentation

  • ‚Ä¢ Premium 9.5/10 design: Stunning wine portfolio
  • ‚Ä¢ Photo galleries: Beautiful bottle shots display
  • ‚Ä¢ Perfect for: 30% prioritizing design quality. Smaller portfolios (50-100 wines). Premium presentation = perceived quality = higher margins. Choose when design matters most.

üìê #3 Squarespace - Template-Based

  • ‚Ä¢ Polished 8.5/10 design: Beautiful food/beverage templates
  • ‚Ä¢ Fastest setup: Launch importer site in 4-6 hours
  • ‚Ä¢ Perfect for: 10% who want templates. Less customization, faster setup. Good for importers who don't want to design from scratch.

Brutal truth: Wine importers with online catalogs get 3x more B2B inquiries. Portfolio = restaurant clients.

Most wine importers (60%): Choose Webflow. Legendary CMS for 200+ wines = comprehensive catalog. Advanced filtering = find wines by region/grape/price/vintage = easy browsing. Wholesale pricing = B2B transparency = 70% more orders (no \"contact for pricing\" friction). Client showcase = restaurant logos = social proof = 80% more distributor partnerships. Order sheet downloads = convenience = efficiency. Regional specialization = authority = premium positioning (Burgundy expert vs generalist). Awards/recognition = quality signals = 80% more inquiries. $240/year vs $30K extra revenue = 125x ROI. Most importers with online catalogs see 3x more B2B inquiries.
Design-focused (30%): Choose Framer. Premium 9.5/10 design = stunning wine portfolio. Beautiful bottle shots = perceived quality = higher margins. Smaller portfolios (50-100 wines) don't need Webflow CMS power. Choose when design quality matters most.
Template users (10%): Choose Squarespace. Polished 8.5/10 design from food/beverage templates. Fastest 4-6 hour setup. Less customization but beautiful out-of-box. Good for importers who don't want to design from scratch.
Remember: Wine importing is B2B relationship business. Restaurants/retailers buy from importers they trust. Website with wine portfolio = professionalism = credibility. Online catalog = easy browsing = 3x more inquiries (convenience wins). Client logos = social proof = \"established importer\" = trust. Regional specialization = authority = expert positioning vs commodity. Awards/recognition = quality proof = premium pricing. $240/year platform = $30K extra revenue = best investment importer can make.
